text: really nice roasted coffee beans, barley hulls, sweet caramel malts. oatmeal and molasses with a touch of vanilla. chocolate and espresso roast, full bodied. really well balanced dry stout.

Tap at coopers. Very dark blackish brown small head. Nose is bitter coffee and cocoa. Tastes of cocoa powder, coffee, earth, cola, and roasted malt. Fairly bitter but easy drinking medium bodied. Pleasant

Draught at Rattle & Hum, NYC. Black beer with a decent beige head. Malty chocolate aroma, caramel, licorice, coffee notes, some cocoa powder. Licorice and chocolate flavor, viola notes, caramel, some cocoa. Quite nice balanced stout.

Draught. Inky black with small beige foamy head, slight roastd malt aroma, thin body, medium carbonation, bitter roasted malt taste with slight alcohol flavor, medium bitter finish. Not bad but not really soectacular either.
ticked at the source, i like these, raosty and bitter ,some hop finish but the majoirty of the bitterness is from the malts, nice and clean. didnt like these before.
Draft at the brewpub. Pours near black with a beige head. Medium roasted and muddy malts, moderate sweetness, hints of bitterness, and a nice lingering roasted malty finish. Good stuff.

Pretty good to the style except moderately over carbonated for what it is. Light roast and little to no sweetness as expected. Could have used a richer creamier presence without being quite so sharp and "spritzy" feeling. Not bad.

@ Peekskill. Pours black with decent tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and some chocolate. Taste brings much of the same. Leans toward the bitter end of the stout spectrum, but in the roasted malt way as opposed to hops. Get some rye in there as well. Pretty dry on the palate and quite spritzy. Get a lot of the carbonation and acidic twang in the mouthfeel. At least with this beer it works decently well. Recently Ive found it detracts from the experience. Gotta do it right. Finish is roasty bitter with lightly lingering rye graininess. Pretty solid beer.
Black body, medium sized tan head, soapy lacing. Bittersweet chocolate, roasted malts, light cereals. Medium bodied, gentle carbonation, smooth, dry finish.
Draft at the source. Clear dark maroon color. Aroma of black coffe, bitter cocoa. Taste is unsweetened chocolate and espresso. Nice.

Tap at the brewery. Pours opaque black with a medium, frothy tan head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is leather, roast and chocolate malt, light coffee, prunes and figs with spicy hops. Flavor is malt dominant, medium hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught. Pours with a big billowy brown head leaving lace. Aroma has a striking savory meaty quality that jumps past the chocolate and roast. The taste is roasty sweet like a proper Irish stout with a more dark coffee dust and charcoal bitterness. Similar meaty quality. Ends a tad lactic. Feel is super soft though the roast starts to dominate. Really nice though odd.
Draft at barcade. Medium bodied black pour. Dry roastiness, chocolatety flavor and aroma rather simple but well executed. Solid stout

On tap at the brewpub. Pours black with a thin light tan head. Aroma of sweet lactose, roasted malt, chocolate. Flavor of bitter chocolate, roasted malt, roasted bitterness. Dry, bitter, tasty stout!
7/4/8/4/14 (3.7/5)
On tap at PB.  This had lots of coffee aroma & taste.  Some dry rye in the finish. Nice.

Draft at the brewery with Andrew and Brian. Pours a deep brownish black with thin creme lacing. Aroma is bitter chocolate, light malt, and oat. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of bitter chocolate, light roast and toasted malts.

On cask at the brewery.  Pours a deep brown to black with a thin to medium sized dense tanned beige head.  Aroma of toasted sesame, cocoa, roast and chocolate.  Medium bodied,  smooth and full of toasted cocoa and warm chocolate brownies.  Lovely roast going on here, hints of sesame and coconut.  Nutty and warm, super smooth and easy drinking.  Delicious lingering cocoa.
